sen.j: 日本泳法（にほんえいほう）は古式泳法とも呼ばれる、日本古来の泳ぎ方のことである。
sen.e: Nihon eiho, also called Koshiki eiho, is a Japanese traditional style of swimming.
Nihon eiho, also called Koshiki eiho, is a Japanese traditional style of swimming.
Nihon eiho, also called Koshiki eiho, is a Japanese traditional style of swimming.

sen.j: 通常の泳ぎ方のみではなく、甲冑を着用しての着衣水泳というべき泳法や、水中での格闘技術や立ち泳ぎでの火縄銃の射撃などの武術としての水中での戦闘技術も含む（流派によっては操船術も含む）ものである。
sen.e: It includes not only the normal swimming but swimming in armor and combat techniques in the water as a military art such as fighting techniques in the water and firing a matchlock while treading water; some schools also teach seamanship. These names are the ones given after the Meiji Restoration, and the original names are 'suizyutsu', 'suiren', 'tosuizyutsu', 'yueizyutsu', 'syusuizyutsu', etc.

It includes not only the normal swimming, but swimming in armor and combat techniques in the water as a military art, such as fighting techniques in the water and firing a matchlock while treading water (Some schools also teach seamanship.)
sen.cmt: カンマを補い、最後の部分をカッコに修正しました。
sen.e: It includes not only the normal swimming, but swimming in armor and combat techniques in the water as a military art, such as fighting techniques in the water and firing a matchlock while treading water (Some schools also teach seamanship.)

sen.j: これらは、明治以降の名称であり、通常は「水術」「水練」「踏水術」「游泳術」「泅水術」等が本来の名称である。
sen.e: These names are the ones given after the Meiji period, and the original names are 'suizyutsu,' 'suiren,' 'tosuizyutsu,' 'yueizyutsu,' 'syusuizyutsu,' etc.
sen.cmt: 前列に２文が入っていたので、前列より分けました。Meiji Restration→Meiji period と修正しました。引用符内のカンマの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: These names are the ones given after the Meiji period, and the original names are 'suizyutsu,' 'suiren,' 'tosuizyutsu,' 'yueizyutsu,' 'syusuizyutsu,' etc.

sen.j: 海や河で戦闘、あるいは身を守るための泳ぎで、かつては武士のたしなみとして重んじられた。
sen.e: They were swimming techniques for samurai to fight in the water and rivers, or to protect themselves, and were considered important as the necessary accomplishments of a samurai.
They were swimming techniques for samurai to fight in the water and rivers, or to protect themselves, and were considered important as the necessary accomplishments of a samurai.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: They were swimming techniques for samurai to fight in the water and rivers, or to protect themselves, and were considered important as the necessary accomplishments of a samurai.

sen.j: 古武道と同じく、江戸時代に発展したものが多い。
sen.e: Like the old Japanese martial arts, many of them were developed in the Edo Period.
Same as the kobudo (classical material arts), many of them were developed in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: Like→Same as と修正しました。「古武道」をマイページに従い修正しました。Period→period と修正しました。
sen.e: Same as the kobudo (classical material arts), many of them were developed in the Edo period.

sen.j: しかし江戸時代後期を中心に生じたものには実用性が必ずしも高くないものも少なくなく、一流派ですべての水勢に対して必要な泳法を備えるものはないとされ、1932年、文部省の指示によって日本水上競技連盟は在来の泳法のうち重要なものを採択し、スピードを主とした競技泳法を加えて「標準泳法」とし、国民必修のものとした。
sen.e: However, those started in the late Edo Period were not always practical, and one school did not prepare the necessary styles for all the different forces of water, and so in 1932, Japan Aquatic Competition Federation (forerunner of Japan Swimming Federation) selected important ones from the traditional styles, designating them to be 'standard styles of swimming' including competitive styles focused on speed, setting them as compulsory education for elementary school kids.
sen.cmt: 「国民必修のものとした」という箇所は、調べた結果「小学校での必修科目とした」という訳にしました。 泳法の中の「逆飛」「立飛」は、飛び込みだと解釈しました。
sen.e: However, those started in the late Edo period were not always practical, and considered that a school could not cope with all the different forces of water, and so in 1932, Japan Aquatic Competition Federation (forerunner of Japan Swimming Federation) selected important ones from the conventional styles, designating them to be 'standard styles of swimming' including competitive styles focused on speed, setting them as a compulsory subject at schools.
sen.cmt: Period→period,traditional→conventional と修正しました。compulsory education for elementary school kids→a compulsory subject at school （「学校での必須科目」として修正しました）

sen.j: それはクロール、背泳（せおよぎ）、平泳（ひらおよぎ）、伸泳（のしおよぎ）、片抜手（かたぬきて）、扇平泳（あおりひらおよぎ）、抜手（ぬきて）、立泳（たちおよぎ）、潜（もぐ）り、浮身（うきみ）、逆飛（さかとび）、立飛（たちとび）の12種、足の動作はばた足、扇足、蛙足、踏（ふみ）足の4種。
sen.e: They were the crawl, backstroke, breaststroke, "noshioyogi (sidestroke)", "katanukite (one arm swing stroke)", "aori-hiraoyogi (breaststroke with swinging legs)", "nukite (swing stroke)", "tachioyogi (treading water)", "moguri (diving)", "ukimi (floating)", "sakatobi (headlong dive)", and "tachitobi (standing dive)"(12 kinds), and the leg motions were "bata-ashi (kick)"aori-ashi" (swing), "kaeru-ashi" (frog kick), and "humi-ashi" (tread) (4 kinds).

They were 12 kinds such as the crawl, backstroke, breaststroke, "noshioyogi" (sidestroke), "katanukite" (one arm swing stroke), "aori-hiraoyogi" (breaststroke with swinging legs), "nukite" (swing stroke), "tachioyogi" (treading water), "moguri" (diving), "ukimi" (floating), "sakatobi" (headlong dive), and "tachitobi" (standing dive), and the leg motions were 4 kinds such as "bata-ashi" (kick), aori-ashi" (swing), "kaeru-ashi" (frog kick), and "humi-ashi" (tread).

sen.j: 現在、12の流派が日本水泳連盟により公認されている。
sen.e: At present there are 12 schools authorized by the Japan Swimming Federation.

sen.j: なお、技法にはシンクロナイズドスイミングと共通する技があり、日本にシンクロナイズドスイミングを導入したのもその共通性に注目した日本泳法の団体である。
sen.e: They have some techniques as well as synchronized swimming in common, and it was an organization devoted to Japanese swimming style that noticed the commonality and introduced it to Japan.

There are some techniques as in common with synchronized swimming, and it was a group of Nihon eiho who introduced the synchronized swimming to Japan since they noticed the commonality between the two.

sen.j: 毎年春には全国各地で日本泳法研究会が、毎年夏には日本泳法大会が開催される。
sen.e: Meetings for Japanese swimming style are held every spring, and competitions are held every summer in various parts of the country.
Meetings for Japanese swimming style are held every spring in various parts of the country, and Japanese Martial Arts Swimming Championship is held every summer.

sen.j: 現在では日本泳法を学ぶ場はほとんどが一般のプールであり、特別のイベントなどでない限り褌等の伝統的スタイルで泳ぐことはない。
sen.e: Nowadays, in most cases, regular swimming pools are used to learn this style of swimming, and swimmers do not wear traditional "hundoshi (loincloth)"unless they swim in a special event.

sen.e: Both men and women wear regular swimsuits for competitive swimming.

sen.j: 日本泳法は決して「古い」泳法ではなく、現在でも有用・有益な泳法であり、古色を求めることに目的があるわけではない。
sen.e: Japanese swimming style is not an 'old' style but is a useful and beneficial one, and it's not the purpose to be overly nostalgic.
